    • Constructor Detail

      • BloomFilter

        public BloomFilter(double n,
           double p)
        Constructs a new bloom filter by determining the optimal bloom filter size n in bits and the number of hash functions k based on the expected number n of elements in the bloom filter and the tolerable false positive rate p.
        Parameters:
        n - Expected number of elements inserted in the bloom filter
        p - Tolerable false positive rate

      • BloomFilter

        public BloomFilter(int m,
           int k)
        Constructs a new bloom filter of the size m bits and k hash functions. You can calculate the optimal parameters using the static methods optimalK(double, int) and/or optimalM(double, double), depending on wether you want to provide the tolerable false positive probability or the exact size of the bloom filter.
        Parameters:
        m - The size of the bloom filter in bits.
        k - The number of hash functions to use.

      • BloomFilter

        public BloomFilter(java.util.BitSet bloomFilter,
           int m,
           int k,
           BloomFilter.HashMethod hashMethod,
           java.lang.String hashFunctionName)
        Constructs a new bloom filter by using the provided bit vector bloomFilter.
        Parameters:
        bloomFilter - the bit vector used to construct the bloom filter
        k - the number of hash functions used
        hashMethod - hash function type
        hashFunctionName - name of the hash function to be used for the cryptographic HashMethod, i.e. MD2, MD5, SHA-1, SHA-256, SHA-384 or SHA-512

    • Method Detail

      • optimalM

        public static int optimalM(double n,
           double p)
        Calculates the optimal size m of the bloom filter in bits given n (expected number of elements in bloom filter) and p (tolerable false positive rate).
        Parameters:
        n - Expected number of elements inserted in the bloom filter
        p - Tolerable false positive rate
        Returns:
        the optimale size m of the bloom filter in bits

      • optimalK

        public static int optimalK(double n,
           int m)
        Calculates the optimal k (number of hash function) given n (expected number of elements in bloom filter) and m (size of bloom filter in bits).
        Parameters:
        n - Expected number of elements inserted in the bloom filter
        m - The size of the bloom filter in bits.
        Returns:
        the optimal amount of hash functions k

      • setHashMethod

        public void setHashMethod(BloomFilter.HashMethod hashMethod)
        Sets the method used to generate hash values. Note that all previously inserted elements become invalid if you change this setting and the bloom filter should be reset using clear() before being used again. Possible hash methods are:
        • Hashmethod.Cryptographic is the default. It uses a cryptographic hash function (e.g. MD5, SHA-512, default is MD5) which can be set using setCryptographicHashFunction(String). It slices the digest in bit ranges of x with 2^x > m and does rejection sampling for each slice. It is fast and very well distributed.
        • Hashmethod.RNG uses the random number generator of Java, which is a Linear Congruant Generator (LCG). It is very fast but doesn't distribute hash values very uniformly.
        • Hashmethod.SecureRNG uses the secure random number generator of Java, which statifies a high degree of randomness at the cost of CPU time.
        • Hashmethod.CarterWegman implements the Carter Wegman Universal Hashing Function. It has very good theoretical guarantees for the uniform disitribution of hash values but can be ~10 times slower than other methods, as it has to perform arithmetic operations on potentially large numbers.
        • Hashmethod.CRC32 uses a CRC32 checksum. It is rather fast an offers a good distribution.
        • Hashmethod.Adler32 uses the Adler32 checksum. Adler32 is faster than CRC32 but offers a slightly less uniform distribution.
        • Hashmethod.Murmur uses the Murmur 2 hash function. It is a new and increasingly popular hash function that is fast and very uniformly distributed.
        Parameters:
        hashMethod - the method used to generate hash values

      • setCryptographicHashFunction

        public void setCryptographicHashFunction(java.lang.String hashFunctionName)
        Uses the given cryptographic hash function. Note that all previously inserted elements become invalid and the bloom filter should be reset using clear() before being used again.
        Parameters:
        hashFunctionName - name of the hash function to be used, i.e. MD2, MD5, SHA-1, SHA-256, SHA-384 or SHA-512

      • setCusomtHashFunction

        public void setCusomtHashFunction(BloomFilter.CustomHashFunction chf)
        Uses a given custom hash function. Note that all previously inserted elements become invalid and the bloom filter should be reset using clear() before being used again.
        Parameters:
        chf - the custom hash function

      • hash

        public int[] hash(java.lang.String value)
        Dispatches the hash function defines via setHashMethod(HashMethod) (default: cryptographic hash function).
        Parameters:
        value - the value to be hashed
        Returns:
        array with k integer hash positions in the range [0,m)

      • union

        public boolean union(BloomFilter<T> other)
        Performs the union operation on two compatible bloom filters. This is achieved through a bitwise OR operation on their bit vectors. This operations is lossless, i.e. no elements are lost and the bloom filter is the same that would have resulted if all elements wer directly inserted in just one bloom filter.
        Parameters:
        other - the other bloom filter
        Returns:
        true if this bloom filter could successfully be updated through the union with the provided bloom filter

      • intersect

        public boolean intersect(BloomFilter<T> other)
        Performs the intersection operation on two compatible bloom filters. This is achieved through a bitwise AND operation on their bit vectors. The operations doesn't introduce any false negatives but it does raise the false positive probability. The the false positive probability in the resulting Bloom filter is at most the false-positive probability in one of the constituent bloom filters
        Parameters:
        other - the other bloom filter
        Returns:
        true if this bloom filter could successfully be updated through the intersection with the provided bloom filter

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()

      • getFalsePositiveProbability

        public double getFalsePositiveProbability(int n)
        Returns the probability of a false positive (approximated):
        (1 - e^(-k * insertedElements / m)) ^ k
        Parameters:
        n - The number of elements already inserted into the Bloomfilter
        Returns:
        probability of a false positive after n add(byte[]) operations

      • getBitsPerElement

        public double getBitsPerElement(int n)
        Calculates the numbers of Bits per element, based on the expected number of inserted elements n.
        Parameters:
        n - The number of elements already inserted into the Bloomfilter
        Returns:
        The numbers of bits per element

        public double getBitZeroProbability(int n)
        Returns the probability that a bit is zero.
        Parameters:
        n - The number of elements already inserted into the Bloomfilter
        Returns:
        probability that a certain bit is zero after n add(byte[]) operations
